text: <@U7SL518D6> commented on <@U7D5W6EVA>’s file <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/files/U7D5W6EVA/F9ANN55EX/-.html|https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/files/U7D5W6EVA/F9ANN55EX/-.html>: looks like you’re inspecting the page while in the page editor, view the preview of the page or go to the live page and you should not see those styles added.

comment.comment: looks like you’re inspecting the page while in the page editor, view the preview of the page or go to the live page and you should not see those styles added.

text: A file, which can't be shown because your team is past the free storage limit, was commented on.
<@U22PJPGK0> this was the tutorial I was trying to follow at first: <http://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/tutorials/building-from-plain-html>

I noticed that in one of our portals where we had HubSpot developers create the templates for us, there is a /content/modules folder. in there are bunch of folders named "[module_id]-[module name]". and inside of those are some json files (looks like it maps to fields in a custom module. and the module html,css.js.  
I see that there's currently no way to upload custom modules ( <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/Content-Design-Questions/Why-Can-t-I-import-export-Custom-Modules-as-JSON-objects/td-p/9530>) However Is there the option for us to create custom modules for local development and is there any documentation on it?
We have tried and it doesnt let us overwrite what is already there.
<@U38EZFVFE> you have tried deploying to your HubSpot instance, or you have tried creating new modules locally?
you can download them but not over write them
ah. so can I create modules in my local environment using that same format as what's in there and use them with HUBL local server

I have overwritten some custom modules by FTP, the real problem is that you can not create them locally as you can not generate an unique ID for the CM neither for each field. So it let you a really low actions to do by FTP/local.
I hope they do a new process so we can manage it locally. I am hoping it for long time (same for templates for the visual editor).

<@U7ADCU3BM> do you know why some portals have that folder and some don't. I'm coding a site now which is all HTML and custom modules. however I don't see a modules folder in the FTP.  I really want a local dev workflow, but with so many custom modules it's not worth it just to replace chunks of code with custom modules once we push to HubSpot
Probably because they don't have activated the new beta for the designer I guess
ah.. that would align with what I'm seeing.

Andy most of what they have been working on hasn't been released yet or is in Beta. Whats coming though is a big improvement. It's an adjustment but after you get the hang of it I think you will find it takes you much less time to build websites and maintain them. Well, you don't have to maintain them and thats the best part.
